The festival was excenentexcellent in many ways, and especiallyin particular it being an international festival was a challenging, but brilliant idea. I assume that this fact attracted people very much. In addition to that, organising one weekend with special price tickets was particularly good. I personally think that it helped many people who were not able to afford the tickets withat the propernormal price to come to the festival. Moreover, most of the events I went to were fantastic.

However, I still have some comments to make to improve the festival next year. The festival was supposed to be an international one, but the artists and stars who participated in it were from six countries only. Thus, I recommend that stars and artists of various nationalities should be invited. Also, some of the concert halls where the musicians performed were not big enough for the vast number of audiencesattendees. I think it would be much better to use bigger concert halls. Furthermore, I found that there were not many genres ofin neither the films noreither the films or the plays. So I suggest you have various kinds, and more numbers of plays and films next year.

Science and technology characterize our modermodern society. They have takenmade a big progress in our every dayeveryday life and they have always becomeare always becoming more important for us. If you think that fifty years ago, when there weren't cars or any sort of comfortcomforts (born just in the "industrial age") everything had to be done by handshand or by animal worklabour: I think inat that time life was really much harder than now! We have to say that technological searchesadvances have taken ingiven our society "their good fruits" but, at the same time, they have negative aspects too. Walking on a city street, it's difficult to find parks or "green" places with trees and clean air: actually pollution, traffic and noizenoise are the main problems of our society. I know I'm a "daughter of this techologicaltechnological world" and unlucklyunluckily I think I could'ncouldn't staylive without it: it's rather strange that today there's alreadystill somebody without a phone, dishwasher, TV... But, sometimes I ask myself if the "ancient world", without science, technological discoveriesinnovations and industries was more authentic than the our one.

In the first part of this book it can be seen that Woods is not on the side of the blacks although he didn't approve of the government's attitude totowards them. In some ways, he did not agree with "Black Consciousness" which is Biko's organization because it was too much against the whites. Woods thought he knew the black society quite well and understood their ordeals, but after he had met Biko and visited a black township, he realized he had been completely unaware of the way they had to live. The people and the circumstances he experienced in the black township were such a new world to him. Finally he changed his ideas and started to work for the blacks using his skill as a journalist, in. In other words, he became an activist for the black people of South Africa.

TO THE MANAGER OF "THE CIRCLE THEATRE" AFTER FINISHING A STRESSFUL YEAR AT SCHOOL, I TOOK A SHORT HOLIDAY, WHOSEAND ITS "SPLENDID ENDING" WAS A WEEK IN LONDON,. WHILE I WAS THERE, I SAW A VERY ATTRACTIVE SIGN: THE "OVER THE RAINBOW""OVER THE RAINBOW" THE MUSICAL SHOW WAS BEING PLAYEDPLAYING AT YOUR THEATRE, MOREOVER, THE WONDERFUL DANNY BROOK WAS THE PROTAGONISTSTAR OFIN IT. SADLY, I DECIDED TO GO, ALONG WITH MY GIRLFRIEND, BUT THE PROBLEMS STARTED EVEN BEFORE THE SHOW, WHEN WE WANTED TO BUY THE TICKETS. WE ASKED ABOUT "THE DISCOUNTS" THAT WERE OFFERED IN THE ADVERTISEMENT AND THE ONLY THING THAT THE LADY WHO WAS SELLING THE TICKETS COULD SAY WAS: WHAT DISCOUNTS? THEN, WE MOVED INSIDE THE THEATRE AND WE HAD TO WAIT 45 MINUTES UNTIL THE SHOW BEGAN!!, WHILE WE WERE WAITING, WE THOUGHT WE COULD GO TO THE RESTAURANT AFTER THE EVENT, AND THEN, WE REALIZED IT WAS CLOSED. BY THE TIME THE SHOW STARTED, WE WERE SO ANGRY THAT THE ONLY THING I REMEMBER IS THAT DANNY BROOK WASN'T ACTING. I THINK YOU HAVE ALREADY REALIZED THAT IT WASN'T A PLEASURE FOR US TO SEE THE SHOW, SO I HOPE YOU COULDCAN GIVE ME OUR MONEY BACK, IF YOU CAN'T, PLEASE, AT LEAST GIVE ME AN EXPLANATION. YOURS FAITHFULLY

Unfortunately, Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets. In fact this was the main cause ofreason for Mr White's resignation and suicide. Pat was not a very clever teen-agerteenager and while she was attending the Secondary School she had many troublesproblems with Chemistry. I could actually say that if it hadn't been for Mr. White she would have nevernever have passed her exam to enter University. Mr White came to our school when he was 40 year-oldyear oldyears old but still well-lookinggood-looking and all my girlsfemale school-mates fell suddenly in love with him; he was always so kind and generous towards his pupils that any girlsgirl felt herself loved by him: Pat certainly was one of them. One day while she was walking in Central Park she saw a man and a young girl sitting under a tree. Immediately she recognized her beloved teacher kissing one of her class mateclassmateclassmates and she runran away as fast as she could. She was so angry and felt so betrayed by Mr White that without any exitationhesitation she went to the school Headmaster to report everything she had seen. The next day Mr White was charged forwith abusesabuse and obliged to resign. The trial was long and hadreceived a wide coverage byfrom the media. We live in a small and old fashionedold-fashioned town and Mr. White was considered a monster: loosinglosing his job was hard for him, but even harder was the loss of his beloved pupils who were not allowed to meet him; so, on a bright summer day he took his final decision and died, terrified by the darkness which was nearing.

Today, however, people do not need to spend manymuch timestime on making food, washing up, or even on turning on anand off the lightthe light on and off. Machines, such as athe dish washerdishwasher, laundry machinewashing machine and remote controllercontrol help us jutjust to relax or do a little work necessarynecessary work. From my point of viewIn my opinion, people's homehomes in the future will be controlled by a computer which is devisedbuilt ininto every machine, TV, cooker and the light, connectingconnected to the owner. He/she can just press the button or send e-mail to operate what he/she needs, even though the owner is far from the house. Dear Sir or Madam, With reference to your advertismentadvertisement regarding the musical show "Over the rainbow" I am writing to you with the intention of to givegiving you an impression of our experiences visitingattending the above mentionedabove-mentioned show. We were disappointed to realize that not Danny Brook but a different actor played one of the main characters. Honestly it was a less impressive performance than we had expected. According to your advertismentadvertisement the play should have started at 19:30. Unfortunately there was an unexplained delay of 45 minutes. The audience had to sit and wait until 20:15. What made the situation worse is that no explanation for the delay was given; not even an apologationapology. We had been told that discounts toon the ticket-pricesticket prices were possibleavailable but aton the evening of the show no discounts or special offers whatsoever were offered. After the show we had intended to visit your theatre restaurant, which was - to our surprise - closed because of the time delay! So we had to leave hungry and with a certain feeling of frustration and disappointment. Honestly for us it was not that "perfect evening out". We would like to ask you if there is any chance of to getgetting our money back of or if you can offer any other alternative for our convenience? We are looking forward to hearing from you. Yours faithfully M. S.
